Data: North to Pietersen, FOUR runs and Pietersen uses his feet well here, advances to the offspinner and lofts a drive over mid-on, not timed perfectly but it was safe all the same
North to Pietersen, no run straight-bat defence this time
North to Pietersen, no run drifts onto the pads, it's defended to leg
North to Pietersen, 1 run worked away to square leg
North to Strauss, no run well, not with this ball, though it was wide outside off, his cut doesn't beat point
North to Strauss, no run and driven to mid-off

Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run oh, KP almost a brain-freeze there! He's chopped it into the ground and as it bounces up he puts his hand out as if to grab it, then rethinks and leaves it, then thinks about handling it again, then remembers him
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run oh, another close one! He's tried to hook this one and it's flown off the top edge, lobs up behind square, Haddin can't quite get there in time
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, 1 run clipped away to square leg and Pietersen will be happy to get off strike there
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run left alone outside off
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, 3 runs and there's the hundred for Strauss! He cuts it away behind point, McDonald on the boundary stops the four but three is enough and what a super innings it's been
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run defended to cover
North to Strauss, no run outside off and defended
North to Strauss, no run tighter line. Strauss smothers it like an experienced murderer
North to Strauss, no run good line - or good areas, as Monty might say - which spits away from Strauss
North to Strauss, 1 run short and clunked off the back foot
North to Pietersen, 1 run nurdled off his toes
North to Strauss, no run nice ball - floating it up high and forcing Strauss to reach for it
Siddle to Pietersen, no run very full and a little stiff, driven to mid-on
Siddle to Pietersen, no run driven to mid-on
Siddle to Pietersen, no run left alone outside off
Siddle to Pietersen, FOUR runs oh take that. Pietersen at his best - a front-foot cover-driven slap for four. Bosh
Siddle to Pietersen, no run slightly tighter line and a better length

Siddle to Pietersen, FOUR runs driven hard back to Siddle, through his hands, through his legs for four. That was a real toe-crusher - from Pietersen, not Siddle - and can barely be described a chance, but nevertheless I'm still going to have t
North to Strauss, no run wide of the off stump, spinning away from Strauss who ignores it
North to Strauss, no run crisply driven - fuller delivery
North to Strauss, 1 run gives this massive amounts of flight - that's got snow on it, surely? Neat drive out to cover
North to Pietersen, 1 run tickled to leg
North to Strauss, no run excellent ball - turn and, crucially, bounce for North who beats Strauss's cut. Good take by Haddin
North to Strauss, no run cut off the back foot
Siddle to Pietersen, OUT got him! Terrific ball that moved away just a touch from Pietersen, drawn forward into a drive, and it took a thin outside edge to a diving Haddin behind the stumps
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run cuts back and left alone
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run on the back foot and he defends
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run too wide to trouble Collingwood and it's left alone
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run 92mph on the off stump and clunked over the head of the bowler
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run nudges this to leg to end a very fine, aggressive, wholehearted and successful wicket maiden

North to Strauss, no run a little teaser outside off, and bowled incredibly slow. Like one of my filth legbreaks, barely breaking the 40mph mark, but that's the key on this pitch - bowl it slow, let it turn
North to Strauss, 2 runs cut away behind square
North to Strauss, 1 run waits for it on the back foot, forcing it hard off the back foot past point
North to PD Collingwood, no run flighted outside off, he's forward and blocking
North to PD Collingwood, no run on the back foot, defending this wideish delivery
North to PD Collingwood, no run and it's blocked to end the over
Siddle to Strauss, no run well wide and left alone by Strauss
Siddle to Strauss, no run short of a good length, Strauss defends on the back foot with the straightest of bats

Siddle to Strauss, FOUR runs slashed and dropped by the diving gully - another catch goes down, this one by Mike Hussey. Loose shot by Strauss though he absolutely smashed it, and those are the catches Australia really need to take
Siddle to Strauss, no run full toss - attempted yorker but didn't quite come out right. He's bowling sharply, here, Siddle - all above 90mph
Siddle to Strauss, no run ooh good ball - terrific delivery cutting back into Strauss who leaves it alone
Siddle to Strauss, no run on the back foot, defending
North to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood comes down the pitch and tries to whip him to mid-on but can't time it
North to PD Collingwood, no run on the back foot, defending it clunkily
North to PD Collingwood, no run driven through cover. Lazy work allows a single
North to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs solid thump. Down the ground, bunts him with heavy short-arm power down the ground
North to PD Collingwood, 1 run waits for it on the back foot, dangerously so, but Collingwood's nurdling it for a single
North to Strauss, no run ignored outside off
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run very good line in the corridor of uncertainty. That's where to bowl to Collingwood who thought about playing, but left it
Siddle to PD Collingwood, 1 run quick ball, 90mph+, flicked to leg
Siddle to Strauss, no run wide of Strauss and left alone
Siddle to Strauss, no run oh that's runs, that is. No it's not. A firm clip is stopped by short midwicket.
Siddle to Strauss, no run pushed off the back foot behind square, though he wasn't completely on top of it
Siddle to Strauss, no run quick, short bowling but a touch too wide from Siddle
North to PD Collingwood, no run short of a length, bunted to short midwicket
North to PD Collingwood, no run quicker ball from North, well blocked by Collingwood toward the south of his bat
North to PD Collingwood, 3 runs neat stroke to a stray from North, wide of the off stump and cut behind square
North to Strauss, 1 run swept firmly through the leg side
North to PD Collingwood, 1 run a little tickle to the leg side
North to Strauss, 1 run Strauss steps forward to sweep
Siddle to Strauss, no run angled across Strauss who leaves it alone
Siddle to Strauss, no run on the back foot, defending solidly
Siddle to Strauss, 1 run flicked to leg

Siddle to PD Collingwood, 3 runs Australia's V8 engine lets out a frustrated grunt at drifting onto Collingwood's legs, somewhere they really must avoid. Bread, butter and a whole load of similar things - flicked through the leg side
Siddle to Strauss, 1 run pushed off the back foot for another single. Nice play by England here, ticking over
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run well bowled - cut back markedly on Collingwood who got a thick inside edge
Clarke to Strauss, no run left alone outside off
Clarke to Strauss, 1 run swept square for a single
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run skips down the pitch and drives to mid-off
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run too short, turned to leg
Clarke to Strauss, no run elegant shimmy and a powerfully biff to mid-on
Clarke to Strauss, 1 run skips back and paddles it behind square
Siddle to Strauss, no run Strauss is resolute, ignoring these teasers by Siddle outside off
Siddle to Strauss, no run cuts away from Strauss
Siddle to Strauss, 1 run juicy half-volley on his legs but there's a sweeper on the boundary, preventing another four from Strauss
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run cuts back nastily, jaggedly, and it balloons out to the off side
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run again cuts back on Collingwood, balloons out to the off side
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run stroked to mid-off
Clarke to Strauss, no run on the off stump, defended to leg
Clarke to Strauss, 1 run Strauss goes on the sweep, and fine leg clears up with an enthusiastic gallop. Top galloping by Hilfenhaus
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run good line on middle-and-off, Collingwood smothers
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run pushed out to the off side
Clarke to Strauss, no run quicker ball, Strauss goes back to defend
Clarke to Strauss, 2 runs tucks one off his pads behind square
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run starts nicely with out just outside the off stump, which Collingwood watches pass by
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run left alone outside off
Johnson to PD Collingwood, 1 leg bye on his pads, Collingwood tucks it for a single to bring up England's 300. It's a start. A good start, but only a start.
Johnson to Strauss, 1 leg bye down the leg side and off his pads. Johnson yelps half an appeal but it's miles down the leg side
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run breaking news: swing spotted bending ever so slightly back into Collingwood
Johnson to PD Collingwood, 1 run patted off his pads for a rinky dinky single
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run tossed up outside off, driven back to the bowler
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run skips down the pitch, flicking to leg
Clarke to PD Collingwood, OUT got him! Strauss is fuming with Collingwood here, as he skips down the pitch and miscues it - a horrible welly - straight to mid-on
Clarke to Prior, no run Prior's back and nudging to leg
Clarke to Prior, no run nudged around the corner. Australia are alive again
Clarke to Prior, no run ooh that hurries Prior a touch, but his wicket remains intact
Johnson to Strauss, no run and action immediately as Strauss edges but it falls just short of Ponting at second slip
Johnson to Strauss, no run pushed away to the off side
Johnson to Strauss, 1 run on the pads, Strauss flicks a single behind square
Johnson to Prior, no run and he drives edgily to the man at gully
Johnson to Prior, FOUR runs guided, although that might be a generous description, between gully and third slip and it runs away for a boundary
Johnson to Prior, FOUR runs and that's almost a carbon copy. Prior drives outside off, it flies away behind gully for four more
Clarke to Strauss, no run turns in a touch, Strauss defends
Clarke to Strauss, FOUR runs that's a well-timed and well-placed square drive, it's a fullish ball and he's punched it away really positively
Clarke to Strauss, 1 run chips an easy single to mid-on
Clarke to Prior, no run curves it in, Prior defends
Clarke to Prior, no run straight-bat defence again
Clarke to Prior, no run full toss, Prior can't beat the man at cover, which is rather lucky for Clarke
Johnson to Strauss, no run bouncer from Johnson, it's too short though and poses no threat to Strauss
Johnson to Strauss, 1 run 80mph or 129kph, Strauss flicks it off his hips to fine-leg
Johnson to Prior, OUT what a cracker! Johnson has got one to swing back in to the right-hander Prior and it's through the gate, takes off stump. Australia are well and truly back in this!
Johnson to Flintoff, no run oops, down leg side and Haddin does well to take it
Johnson to Flintoff, FOUR runs Flintoff gets off the mark with a lovely clip off his pads through square, but that was another ball that swung in to the right-hander
Johnson to Flintoff, no run this one doesn't straighten and it's left alone outside off
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run pushed away harmlessly to point
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, FOUR runs a thick edge here, Strauss slashes at one angled across him and it flies between second slip and gully, in the air but no danger there
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, FOUR runs that's a wonderful shot! Overpitched and Strauss simply leans into an on-drive, he's perfectly positioned and it races away to the boundary
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run no swing from Hilfenhaus, Strauss defends
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run fullish ball, driven to cover
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, (no ball) angled across and left alone
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run good delivery, angled across and it moves sharply as it passes Strauss's outside edge
Johnson to Flintoff, no run digs it in short, so no chance to swing, and Flintoff nudges it down into the ground
Johnson to Flintoff, no run short again, pushing Flintoff back to defend
Johnson to Flintoff, no run another bouncer, even shorter though, and Flintoff ducks it
Johnson to Flintoff, no run fullish length, Flintoff leaves a ball moving across him just outside off, no inswing there
Johnson to Flintoff, no run fuller length, Flintoff drives and clunks it into the turf
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run down leg side, clips the pads and it's well stopped by Haddin
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, 3 runs on the pads and that's well clipped through midwicket, the somewhat recuperated Hauritz does the fielding
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, OUT gone! The old ball works out for Hilfenhaus. A great outswinger takes the edge of Flintoff's bat and Ponting and second slip snaffles the opportunity
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run inswing, definite shape with the old ball and Broad takes a sharpish blow to the nether-regions
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run good ball again, an off-stump line and swinging in towards middle, it's defended by Broad
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run ah, this one doesn't swing and Broad dabs at it, the ball beats his outside edge
Johnson to Strauss, no run defended safely, no swing there
Johnson to Strauss, 1 run shortish outside off, Strauss cuts it away for a single
Johnson to Broad, 1 run no swing from Johnson, it's flicked to leg for a single
Johnson to Strauss, no run dead straight ball, dead straight-bat defence
Johnson to Strauss, 3 runs flicked away wristily through midwicket, that's a good shot and in among the wickets Strauss just keeps accumulating
Johnson to Broad, no run short, just outside off, and Broad leaves it
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run angled across him and left alone
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, 2 runs swivels a pull around forward of square
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run there's a bit of swing in to the pads, Strauss defends
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run defended again on off stump
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run driven to cover, can't beat the field
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run nudged away to point for no run
Johnson to Broad, 3 runs good ball to begin with, a hint of outswing and Broad pushes past point and picks up three as Hauritz chases it down
Johnson to Strauss, FOUR runs too short this time, and wide outside off, Strauss cuts and makes no effort to keep it down, there's no need to as it flies safely down to the vacant third-man region
Johnson to Strauss, no run outside off, left alone
Johnson to Strauss, no run fuller length, Strauss drives to mid-on
Johnson to Strauss, 2 runs almost a boundary there, Strauss clips a straight one off his pads away to deep square leg, where Hilfenhaus runs around and makes a good sliding save
Johnson to Strauss, no run probing outside off, maybe just a hint of swing, Strauss lets it go
Hilfenhaus to Broad, 2 runs Broad leans forward to drive through the leg side
Hilfenhaus to Broad, 1 run good swing, brings it back in and Broad drives just past the bowler to hand the strike back to Strauss
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run clipped to mid-on and can't beat the field
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run angled across Strauss, who pokes it to the off-side
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, 2 runs and there's the 150 for Strauss, he's picked it up by jamming out a yorker length ball and driving it forward of point
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, 1 run drops it into the on-side and they scamper through for a quick single
Johnson to Strauss, no run oops, that's more the Johnson we've seen today. A full toss down leg side
Johnson to Strauss, no run short ball now, Strauss sways out of the way
Johnson to Strauss, no run good ball, shortish outside off and Strauss looks to defend then gets the bat out of the way in time
Johnson to Strauss, 1 run angled in to the pads, Strauss clips it to square leg
Johnson to Broad, no run on the back foot, clunking a drive out to cover
Johnson to Broad, no run play and a miss! Outside off and no real swing, but Broad can't get bat on ball
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run outside off stump and left alone
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, FOUR runs good shot, fullish ball and Strauss watches it wonderfully, drives through cover and that's just a clean, risk-free stroke that epitomises his innings
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run no shot offered this time
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run left alone again, Hilfenhaus is trying to swing it in to Strauss
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run left alone outside off again
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, FOUR runs another boundary, that one races away behind point
Johnson to Broad, no run on off stump, Broad defends
Johnson to Broad, no run Johnson slams it down short and wide outside off, I'd say it was a tired ball except he's been doing that for much of the day
Johnson to Broad, no run good line this time, no swing though, and Broad gets in behind it to defend
Johnson to Broad, no run some sharp bounce late in the day here, Broad gets out of the way
Johnson to Broad, no run that's the slower one, but it's down leg side and no contact is made
Johnson to Broad, no run handled comfortably by Broad, who blocks it in front of off stump
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, no run starts with a really stiff loosener, wide of the off stump
Hilfenhaus to Strauss, OUT GOT HIM! Strauss leaves one which bends back - a disastrous leave from the England captain and his off stump is pegged back. What a start for Australia!
Hilfenhaus to Swann, no run straighter delivery on the middle stump
Hilfenhaus to Swann, no run nice, encouraging shape away from the right-handed Swann who leaves it alone
Hilfenhaus to Swann, no run too wide and left alone
Hilfenhaus to Swann, FOUR runs juicy. On his legs and beautifully clipped for four, though he will need to be wary of the one which straightens on him. Too full from Hilfenhaus though
Siddle to Broad, no run down the leg side, off his hip and bowler and wicketkeeper roar a hopeful appeal.
Siddle to Broad, no run angles across him but it's a bit too wide
Siddle to Broad, (no ball) nicely stroked out to mid-off - full enough to do so
Siddle to Broad, 1 run on the leg stump, pushed out to the off side for a scampered quick single, his first of the morning
Siddle to Swann, no run predictably short, though a little stiff and slow in pace
Siddle to Swann, OUT edged to Ponting at second slip! Brilliant from Siddle, pitching it short and angling it up the hill and at chest height to Swann who angles it straight to slip
Siddle to Anderson, no run snorter! An absolute cracker from Siddle which flew off a length past Broad's outside edge
Hilfenhaus to Broad, FOUR runs on his legs, pulled fine for four. Well played. Runs are suddenly at an absolute premium and much rests on Broad
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run that's a good leave to a ball wide of the off stump. No great movement back into the left-hander this time
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run short of a length and whipped to leg but he can't time it
Hilfenhaus to Broad, no run this one holds its line outside off. Broad leaves alone
Hilfenhaus to Broad, FOUR runs yowzers, that was close! Broad flung his bat a fuller delivery outside off and got a monstrous inside edge which nearly took out his stumps
Hilfenhaus to Broad, OUT bowled him! Three in fifteen minutes for Australia as Broad again attempts a loose drive outside off and drags it on
Siddle to Anderson, no run short and climbs into Anderson who is nervously defending on the tips of his toes
Siddle to Anderson, no run angled across him and beats the outside edge! Australia are all over England like a particularly violent rash
Siddle to Anderson, 1 run clunked out to the off side - oh blimey, trouble here! Throw comes in but it's wide. That would've been curtains
Siddle to Onions, no run a short stray down the leg side - superb snaffle by Haddin diving and leaping to his left
Siddle to Onions, no run short, edged - or angled - to third slip
Siddle to Onions, no run shuffles back and defends awkwardly, but effectively
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run ooh that bends back sharply into the left-hander who's rapped on the pads
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run again, more inswing to Anderson who, to his credit, gets his head right over the ball to defend
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run wide of the off stump and left alone
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run nasty, horrid short ball - very, very well bowled indeed - but Anderson plays this well, jumping up and getting his hands high to fend the ball down
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run an extravagant flay out to the off side
Siddle to Onions, no run sharp, shortish delivery to Onions who, on the back foot, defends it nervously, getting a thick inside edge to his pads
Siddle to Onions, no run shorter delivery that he ducks beneath
Siddle to Onions, 2 runs Onions squeezes it past point for a single
Siddle to Onions, (no ball) well he might be ill, but Siddle's bowled a beauty here that crashes into Onions' helmet
Siddle to Onions, FOUR runs bosh! Upper cut over gully and point for four. Super smash, that
Siddle to Onions, no run left alone outside off
Siddle to Onions, no run a little too short and left alone
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, 3 runs good delivery - good thinking, at least - angling this across the left-hander but Anderson's played it nicely, guiding it past point for a single

Hilfenhaus to Onions, FOUR runs bosh! Great stroke from Onions, slapping this past point off the back foot - almost an orthodox square cut, save for the fact he's a tail-ender. Still - an encouraging and crowd-cheering blow
Hilfenhaus to Onions, no run short, wide and pushed out to the off side

Hilfenhaus to Onions, no run ah, well bowled - almost too much movement for Hilfenhaus here, as the ball bent away markedly on the right-hander who, with tail-end jollity, tried to fling it over the slips and missed
Hilfenhaus to Onions, no run so close! Terrific line from Hilfenhaus - the pick of Australia's bowlers in the series thus far, comfortably - and Onions again rather cluelessly flapped and missed
Hilfenhaus to Onions, 1 run full enough to drive, so he does drive and gets a single out to McDonald at deep extra cover
Johnson to Onions, 1 run little nudge to midwicket and they steal a single. Johnson's sick as a parrot - can't believe they stole a single
Johnson to Anderson, 1 run short of a length and guided out to the off side. Neatly played
Johnson to Onions, no run down the leg side
Johnson to Onions, 1 run guided out to the off side
Johnson to Anderson, no run fuller delivery, nicely bowled, but nicely defended too - pushed out quite crisply to the off side
Johnson to Anderson, FOUR runs pressure on Johnson! Superb back-foot drive, elegantly driven past point to send a packed Lord's crowd into delirium. Nothing like a tailender boshing quick runs
Hilfenhaus to Onions, 1 run Onions! He's gone for a highly ambitious Viv Richards-esque pull on the front foot, but finds mid-on - who flings in a throw but it's wide! More runs for England
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, 2 runs nudged off his hip
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, 1 run Anderson pushed out to the off side
Hilfenhaus to Onions, no run ooh, full and swinging away from Onions who drives and misses
Hilfenhaus to Onions, no run shorter delivery and Onions is showing a propensity for the pull - immense relish (sorry) for pulling Hilfenhaus with one-legged jollity
Hilfenhaus to Onions, 2 runs lifts this over extra cover! Onions on fire here (sorry)

Johnson to Anderson, FOUR runs take that. Superb stroke, but another poor delivery from Johnson - just too full and much, much too wide. Anderson steps back, rocks back, and flangs it through extra cover
Johnson to Anderson, FOUR runs Johnson tries to correct his line but it's much too straight, this time, and it's down the leg side for four more!
Johnson to Anderson, no run short of a length and hurries into the rib-cage area of Anderson who tucks it to leg
Johnson to Anderson, no run back of a length and again nicely defended by a steely eyed Anderson, defending on the back foot and down by his toes. Boycott will be proud
Johnson to Anderson, no run again short, targetting his chest and Anderson is back and defending
Johnson to Anderson, FOUR runs four more - and that's a very clever shot indeed. Short, wide - awful, frankly, from Johnson - and uppercut over backward point for four more
Hilfenhaus to Onions, no run defended out to cover, defended very solidly
Hilfenhaus to Onions, no run beaten outside off - moved away just enough to beat the shaky technique of Onions
Hilfenhaus to Onions, no run on that's unfairly close, it really is! An inch, no more, from taking Onions' outside edge
Hilfenhaus to Onions, no run these are too good for Onions. He plays and misses to another outswinger
Hilfenhaus to Onions, no run fuller and Onions gets in line, defending it solidly this time
Hilfenhaus to Onions, no run outside off, he shuffles back to defend
Johnson to Anderson, 1 run steps to leg and flicks this behind square. Misfield from fine leg but they don't think about two
Johnson to Onions, 1 run slashed hard - catch that! But no, it flies short of third man
Johnson to Anderson, FOUR runs what a shot! Anderson is playing quite brilliantly here, driving on the up and opening the face. Deep backward point hasn't a hope. Class from Anderson
Johnson to Anderson, OUT got him this time! Got big on him and square cut it low to gully who took a fine catch

End of innings Good knock from Anderson there, and that's England's innings. They were looking for 450+ and though they'll be disappointed, 425 is still a decent score. More importantly, the ball is moving considerably this morning and their bowlers -
Mid on, mid off, fine leg - and the rest of the fieldsmen are in an arc from the keeper to point
Anderson to Ponting, no run there's a bit of outswing, though it's left alone by Ponting
Anderson to Ponting, no run no shot offered once again
Anderson to Ponting, no run Ponting lunges forward this time and pushes with purpose, but straight to point
Anderson to Ponting, 2 runs and the captain is away with a confident drive wide of cover, though it wasn't quite timed as he may have liked
Anderson to Ponting, no run angled in this time, trying to get through the gate, but Ponting drives to mid-on
Anderson to Ponting, no run a good bit of inswing there, Ponting defends outside off
Flintoff to Katich, no run pushed across Katich, who lets it go
Flintoff to Katich, 4 leg byes and that one strays down leg, Katich gets some part of his leg to make contact and it runs away to the boundary
Flintoff to Katich, no run great ball! Angled in from around the wicket, then it seams away and bounces well, Katich plays and misses
Flintoff to Katich, no run fuller this time, Katich defends
Flintoff to Katich, no run angled in towards off, Katich blocks it away
Flintoff to Katich, no run bouncer time, and Katich ducks under it comfortably
Anderson to Ponting, no run nice delivery, probing outside off and Ponting can't get bat on ball, that one just straightened ever so slightly
Anderson to Ponting, no run a bit wider this time, Ponting lunges and leaves
Anderson to Ponting, no run angled in straighter now, Ponting falls across towards off and drives to mid-on
Anderson to Ponting, no run oh, Ponting drives at this one and it slams into the turf, he wants a quick single and then realises what a silly idea that would be
Anderson to Ponting, no run left alone outside off

Anderson to Ponting, OUT big appeal, and what's happened here? It was a dual lbw/caught appeal and Ponting is out caught at first slip! Angled in, there must've been an inside edge onto the pad and after Koertzen checks if the ball carried, he g
Flintoff to Katich, no run left alone outside off
Flintoff to Katich, no run 89mph or 144kph, defended on off stump
Flintoff to Katich, no run a bit of inswing from around the wicket, left alone
Flintoff to Katich, 1 run and Katich gets off the mark, eventually, with a clip behind square leg
Flintoff to Hussey, no run left alone outside off, Flintoff is really putting in here
Flintoff to Hussey, no run solid in defence this time
Anderson to Katich, 1 run on the hips, Katich works it away to square leg
Anderson to Hussey, no run angled across Hussey, who lets it go
Anderson to Hussey, no run right on target, Hussey drops it in front of him and thinks about a quick single, then reconsiders
Anderson to Hussey, no run testing Hussey on middle-stump there, he clips it to Cook at leg gully
Anderson to Hussey, no run moves across the batsman with the natural angle from over the wicket, Hussey leaves
Anderson to Hussey, 2 runs this time Hussey beats the field and gets off the mark with a clip through midwicket
Flintoff to Katich, FOUR runs bouncer, and that's well waited by Katich, who gets under it and guides an aerial cut over the cordon and away for four
Flintoff to Katich, no run oh! Play and a miss! That's the really dangerous Flintoff ball, angled in from around the wicket, pitching and seaming away, beats the outside edge
Flintoff to Katich, no run 90mph or 145kph, short of a length and Katich defends
Flintoff to Katich, no run left alone outside off
Flintoff to Katich, no run golly gee, that's another great ball, angling in and seaming away, beating Katich's bat and Flintoff is really causing the batsman some headaches here
Flintoff to Katich, no run left alone this time
Anderson to Hussey, no run and Anderson beats the bat this time, that's a good length, right on off stump and moving away a touch, Hussey can't get bat on it
Anderson to Hussey, 1 run on the pads and he works a single to fine leg
Anderson to Katich, 2 runs nice shot, Katich just prods this one wide of cover and gets a couple of runs
Anderson to Katich, no run defended away to cover
Anderson to Katich, no run right on line, testing Katich on off stump, he defends back to the bowler
Anderson to Katich, no run angled bat from Katich, who guides it to gully
Flintoff to Hussey, no run bouncer! Hussey ducks it, but didn't look terribly comfortable in doing so
Flintoff to Hussey, no run pushed away to point
Flintoff to Hussey, no run left alone outside off
Flintoff to Hussey, no run shortish ball, guided down to point
Flintoff to Hussey, 1 run yorker, but Hussey does well to keep it out and work it away to cover to get off the strike
Flintoff to Katich, no run 92mph or 149kph, Katich lets it go off his body behind square, takes a run but it's adjudged a dead ball as he didn't play a shot
Anderson to Hussey, no run short of a length, he's back and defending
Anderson to Hussey, FOUR runs ah that's bewdyfull - straight down the ground for four. Nothing more than a check-push, timed exquisitely
Anderson to Hussey, 1 run on his legs, Hussey hustles a single to midwicket
Anderson to Katich, no run angled across him, and he wisely leaves it alone
Anderson to Katich, 2 runs good line but well played by Katich, gliding it behind square nicely for three. No, two - Hussey had a slip
Anderson to Katich, no run nudged off his pad. Wrong line from Anderson
Broad to Hussey, no run Broad begins well! Cuts back just a touch on the left-hander who shouldered arms. No chance of losing his off stump, but still, it was a stroke full of risk
Broad to Hussey, no run too wide, left alone
Broad to Hussey, no run on his legs and flipped to leg
Broad to Hussey, no run left alone outside off
Broad to Hussey, no run ignored outside off
Anderson to Katich, no run a touch too wide and left alone
Anderson to Katich, no run miles down the leg side and Katich tries to pull it - dangerous stroke and I think he was out like that in Cardiff. No glove on it this time.
Anderson to Katich, 1 run on his legs, nudged neatly
Anderson to Hussey, no run ducks beneath a shorter delivery
Anderson to Hussey, no run little bit too short and wide. Ignored
Anderson to Hussey, no run oh dear. Way, way too wide
Broad to Katich, no run wide of the off stump and left alone

Broad to Katich, 1 run flicked very late to the leg side. Broad throws his hands up partially in disgust, partially in frustration - a heady mix of the two - as he bent that back into the left-hander quite late
Broad to Hussey, no run that was apparently 93.5mph. It so was not. Quick enough for Hussey, though, beating him on the outside edge
Broad to Hussey, no run wide of the off stump
Broad to Hussey, no run a waste, left alone
Broad to Hussey, no run tripe. Way too wide, and it's raining
Anderson to Katich, no run short of a length and Katich goes back, clunkily pushing it off the back foot - one hand coming off the bat
Anderson to Katich, no run short, outside off and defended on the back foot
Anderson to Katich, no run beaten! Beaten comprehensively - absolutely no footwork from the concreted Katich as he went for a horribly loose drive outside off
Anderson to Katich, no run no no. A waste. Too wide
Anderson to Katich, no run makes him play this time, but Katich is quite comfortable off the back foot
Anderson to Katich, no run ooh, well he was late on that. Went to leave it and got a thick bottom edge
Broad to Hussey, 1 run well played by Hussey, who has looked in good and urgent form today. Nudges this to leg and steals a single
Broad to Katich, FOUR runs don't bowl there. Crisply punched square of the wicket - he is so strong there
Broad to Katich, no run left alone outside off
Broad to Katich, 1 run a short-arm punch off the back foot yields a single
Broad to Hussey, no run too wide, left alone
Broad to Hussey, no run and it's ignored once more
Anderson to Katich, no run on the back foot, he defends out to cover
Anderson to Katich, no run Katich is well back in his crease, forcing this off the back foot
Anderson to Katich, no run wide of the crease, this bends back just a touch on Katich who tries to flash it through cover but the blade closes early, the ball working its way back to the bowler
Anderson to Katich, no run shuffles forward tentatively and prods it back to the bowler
Anderson to Katich, 1 run steals a single to leg
Anderson to Hussey, no run goes for a big pull and nearly dragged this on! That was mighty, might close. Thank god for big boots
Broad to Katich, FOUR runs four - off the bat I think. A leg-side stray. Broad's bowling himself into a long stay down at fine-leg, here, unless he sorts out his line
Broad to Katich, 3 runs crashed through the off side, though without timing it
Broad to Hussey, FOUR runs awful ball. A rank long-hop pulled around the corner for four
Broad to Hussey, no run pushed across Hussey, who leaves it alone
Broad to Hussey, no run good line, Broad gives a shout but it's hit bat and pad together and no umpire is likely to give that
Broad to Hussey, no run left alone outside off
Onions to Katich, no run fullish outside off to start, Katich drives to mid-off
Onions to Katich, no run right up there again, very full to entice a drive, Katich does so to cover
Onions to Katich, no run left alone outside off this time
Onions to Katich, no run pushed across the left-hander, he leaves it to go through to Prior
Onions to Katich, 1 run clipped away to midwicket and they scamper a single
Onions to Hussey, no run bouncer, not a bad line but it's just a tad too high and Hussey is easily underneath it
Broad to Katich, 1 run on the legs, flicked away for a single behind square
Broad to Hussey, 2 runs too straight again, worked easily off his hips for a single
Broad to Hussey, no run pushed away to point
Broad to Hussey, no run nudged into the off side again
Broad to Hussey, no run straight-bat defence here, Broad isn't looking too threatening here
Broad to Hussey, 1 run clipped away through midwicket
Onions to Hussey, FOUR runs good shot, Hussey is quickly into position to pull a short one down and through midwicket for a comfortable boundary
Onions to Hussey, no run left alone outside off
Onions to Hussey, no run 89mph or 143kph, Hussey defends to cover
Onions to Hussey, no run 'no run', says Hussey, echoing our scorer, as he bunts it to cover
Onions to Hussey, no run that one keeps a bit low, on off stump but Hussey is alert enough to get down to it
Onions to Hussey, no run oops, way down leg side
Broad to Katich, 1 run angled in to the pads, Katich clips it away to leg
Broad to Hussey, no run dead-batted away to the off side
Broad to Hussey, FOUR runs nicely placed this time, Hussey just guides a drive fractionally wide of the man diving at cover and his timing is good enough to reach the boundary
Broad to Hussey, no run driven to cover
Broad to Hussey, no run full and straight, Hussey prods it to cover again
Broad to Hussey, no run short, Hussey shapes to pull but then checks himself as it sails past wide of off stump
Onions to Katich, no run 90mph or 145kph, angled across Katich, who lets it go
Onions to Katich, no run ah, that's a good'un! It's pitched on off and straightened off the seam sharply, also some extra bounce and it nips just past Katich's inside edge
Onions to Katich, no run left alone outside off this time, Prior drops the take, which is probably something of a contradiction
Onions to Katich, no run tempting, tempting outside off and Katich chastises himself for chasing that one, it was wide outside off, moving away and he's lucky his slash didn't connect
Onions to Katich, no run 91mph or 146kph, down leg side and Katich doesn't need to play
Onions to Katich, no run another leave outside off, and another fumble from Prior
Broad to Hussey, 1 run on the pads again, Broad has strayed there too often, and it's easy to clip away to fine leg
Broad to Katich, 1 run tries to york Katich, but he flicks it comfortably through midwicket
Broad to Hussey, no run short ball, Hussey sways out of the way

Broad to Hussey, 2 runs shouts of 'caaaatch', and that could easily have gone to hand in the deep, Hussey hooked a bouncer and couldn't keep it down, there's two men in the deep and it's landed safely a few metres wide of deep midwicket
Broad to Hussey, no run another bouncer, this time Hussey leaves it and Prior makes a terrific grab hurling himself to his left

Broad to Hussey, FOUR runs a bouncer, predictably, but that's a magnificent pull from Hussey, he gets over it and hammers it forward of midwicket, it wasn't that wide of a diving Pietersen in the deep but it was struck with such force that he c
Onions to Katich, no run left alone outside off
Onions to Katich, FOUR runs fullish and wide, Katich flashes at a squarish drive and it races away to the cover-point boundary
Onions to Katich, no run no shot offered outside off
Onions to Katich, FOUR runs he's picked the gap again, this time just behind point with a good cut straight down into the turf
Onions to Katich, no run fullish ball, this time Katich walks across - as he nearly always does - but then flicks a drive to mid-on
Onions to Katich, no run solid in defence this time
Swann to Hussey, no run straight ball, defended to leg
Swann to Hussey, FOUR runs that's a really good drive, he's picked a gap in the covers and it runs away to the boundary
Swann to Hussey, no run pushed away towards point, no spin yet from Swann
Swann to Hussey, no run yorker length, Hussey squeezes it out
Swann to Hussey, no run defended back down the pitch
Swann to Hussey, no run no turn again, straight ball and Hussey blocks it away
Onions to Katich, 1 run short of a length, Katich drops it to cover and they hurry through for a single
Onions to Hussey, 1 run that's a vicious pull but just the single, he's so quickly into position for that one and slams it to deep midwicket, straight to the man on the boundary
Onions to Katich, no run pushed across and left alone
Onions to Katich, no run just outside off, Katich prods it back down the pitch
Onions to Katich, no run angled across again, no shot offered, and no swing for Onions
Onions to Katich, 2 runs cuts this one straight down into the turf, it bounces over gully and Katich picks up a couple to finish the session
Flintoff to Hussey, no run left alone outside off
Flintoff to Hussey, no run wide of the crease, helping with his angle across the left-hander. And what an angle it was. Obtuse
Flintoff to Hussey, no run pushed out to the off side
Flintoff to Hussey, no run good pace (90.8mph), lifting up and away from the left-hander
Flintoff to Hussey, no run ooh well bowled - straight bouncer to which he sways out of the way. That flew through
Flintoff to Hussey, 3 runs a confident push out past cover for a couple. Nicely played
Onions to Hussey, no run wide of the off stump and left alone
Onions to Hussey, no run that's a cracker! A fine, fine delivery which shapes back on the left-hander who left it alone on length
Onions to Hussey, FOUR runs smashing shot. In every sense. Hussey has absolutely laced that through cover!
Onions to Hussey, 1 run fuller delivery, squeezed out on the front foot
Onions to Katich, FOUR runs banged down the ground. Power! Nothing more than a bunt down the ground and it fairly raced away for four
Onions to Katich, 1 run nudged off his hip and Australia's 100 is up
Flintoff to Katich, 2 runs uppishly driven, away from his body - not in control of that
Flintoff to Katich, no run good length on the off stump and it's defended out to cover
Flintoff to Katich, no run leaves this alone outside off, and again Flintoff's getting good lift off a decent length
Flintoff to Katich, 1 run on the off stump Katich, as ever, shuffles to the off side and nudges to leg
Flintoff to Hussey, no run very well bowled. Holds its line and, though it was a little too short, that wasn't far away from the off stump
Flintoff to Hussey, no run ignored outside off
Onions to Katich, no run firmly spanked to mid-off
Onions to Katich, no run short of a length and left alone outside off
Onions to Katich, no run good length but too wide. Left alone comfortably

Onions to Katich, OUT this is up in the air at fine leg - what a catch! A stunner from Broad. On the pull, he top-edged it and Broad ran 10 or 12 yards to his right before diving, taking it low. Brilliant
Onions to Hussey, FOUR runs four! Oh yes. Beautiful shot - Hussey has looked supremely confident today. Here, he comes forward and drives through extra cover with the ball right under his nose
Onions to Hussey, no run a full toss but he escapes major punishment, Pietersen cleaning up at mid-off
Flintoff to Clarke, no run ooh, a good nut from Flintoff - cuts back sharply on Clarke who shouldered arms
Flintoff to Clarke, no run nasty bouncer. That flew - that really shot through
Flintoff to Clarke, 1 run flicked to leg
Flintoff to Hussey, (no ball) 1 run on his legs, nudged to leg and there's a gutsy and authoritative fifty from Hussey, from 82 balls
Flintoff to Clarke, no run too wide, though it bent back slightly in the air. Clarke sways out of the way
Flintoff to Clarke, no run solid defensive on the back foot. 93.6mph
Flintoff to Clarke, no run wide of the off stump and left alone
Onions to Hussey, no run steps forward, shouldering arms
Onions to Hussey, no run goes on the pull and a huge appeal from Onions as Prior takes the ball. Not out! Looks like it brushed the shirt, or thigh-pad, or something. An excellent decision
Onions to Hussey, 1 run another pull, down into the ground
Onions to Clarke, no run well wide
Onions to Clarke, no run left alone outside off, again a little too wide really
Onions to Clarke, no run left alone outside off and Prior fumbles it as it crept through low on him
Flintoff to Hussey, no run down the leg side at 92.3mph, though Hussey did have a faint attempt at nudging. A fudging, if you like. Or perhaps not.
Flintoff to Hussey, no run good one. Short and straight, zeroing in on his heart
Flintoff to Hussey, no run squeezed out off a thick outside edge. Superb stop by a diving Pietersen at point
Flintoff to Hussey, no run defended on the off stump. 93.6mph apparently, but I just can't believe or trust the speedo any longer
Flintoff to Hussey, no run blocked off the back foot
Anderson to Clarke, no run sharp pace and movement back into the right-hander, who appeals after rattling him very near the crown jewels. Much too high
Anderson to Clarke, no run that's good from Anderson - a testing off-stump line, bending back into a nervous-looking Clarke
Anderson to Haddin, no run Anderson sends it wide of the off stump and he leaves it well alone
Anderson to Haddin, 3 runs well defended on the back foot - oh, no, a misfield! Hapless effort from backward point. Bopara the guilty one
Anderson to North, no run on the off stump and driven with confidence out to cover
Flintoff to Haddin, no run big shout as Flintoff cuts this back in, but that'll be too high, surely. And yes, it's given not out, but Flintoff's bowling like the wind here - heavy, nasty deliveries
Flintoff to Haddin, FOUR runs he's timed the leather off that! What a superb off-drive from Haddin, standing tall and holding the pose with a terrific, classy shot. This guy is a serious bat
Flintoff to Haddin, no run shuffles back, gets right in line
Flintoff to Haddin, no run that has flown through. Left alone outside off and it lifts nastily. Flintoff glares, sweat pouring off his head. What a terrifying sight he is

Flintoff to Haddin, no run brilliant! Cuts back into Haddin, the ball gets trapped in the flap of his right pad. Haddin skips away from the fielder nervously with the ball still lodged, worried someone might pluck it and claim a catch, but even
Flintoff to Haddin, no run left alone outside off to end a seriously fast over
Anderson to North, no run wide of the crease, late swing into his off stump
Anderson to North, no run swinging away from the left-hander
Anderson to North, no run well wide of the off stump
Anderson to North, no run comfortably left alone, though Anderson's generating some serious wheels and bending the ball like Beckham
Anderson to North, no run defended on the back foot
Anderson to North, 4 byes wide of the off stump and it shoots through a little low on Prior, though he really should've stopped that
Flintoff to Haddin, no run he jumps back to defend
Flintoff to Haddin, 2 leg byes ooh, fends this off his hip I think. Aggressive, nasty bowling from Flintoff
Flintoff to Haddin, FOUR runs what a shot! A square-drive of class and flair, playing it behind point. Superb stuff from Haddin. He's such a great player to watch
Flintoff to Haddin, (no ball) jumps back and defends
Flintoff to Haddin, 3 runs that hurried him! Even on the back foot, Haddin had to jab down on it late and flick it through midwicket. Timed it well
Flintoff to North, no run massive pace again from Flintoff and he's back, across and defending
Flintoff to North, no run North steps back to block it off the back foot, and Flintoff - puce in the face, sweat pouring off him - glares back as though ready to knock his block off
Anderson to Haddin, no run inswinger, bashed back to Anderson. Good length, good pace - Anderson's on the money here
Anderson to Haddin, no run swings back late on Haddin and that kept horribly low - he did so well to get his bat in front of the stumps! Anderson's bending it markedly, at pace
Anderson to Haddin, no run swings back again, and Haddin is watchfully jabbing a defensive to leg
Anderson to Haddin, 3 runs flicked to leg
Anderson to North, no run rare tripe from Anderson, miles wide of the off stump
Anderson to North, no run full delivery on the off stump but very well played by North, crunching it hard back past the bowler. This game is alive - it's buzzing like you wouldn't believe
Broad to Haddin, no run straight ball to start, Haddin defends
Broad to Haddin, no run bunted back down the pitch again
Broad to Haddin, no run driven hard into the ground, it bounces high and Haddin protects his stumps

Broad to Haddin, FOUR runs nice shot from Haddin, he's driven that just wide of mid-on, where Anderson dives over the ball and it dribbles away to the boundary for four, not superbly timed but he did enough
Broad to Haddin, no run defended to leg this time
Broad to Haddin, no run pushed to mid-off and there's no run
Anderson to North, no run angled across North, who lets it go
Anderson to North, no run left alone again, this one straightens but not enough to take the off stump
Anderson to Johnson, no run left alone to start with
Anderson to Johnson, no run angled across Johnson, who leaves it
Anderson to Johnson, no run good ball, pitches on off and moves away a touch, Johnson plays and misses
Broad to Haddin, no run Haddin leans into a cover-drive here, can't beat the field
Broad to Haddin, no run Broad appeals, Doctrove denies him. Angled in to Haddin, it hits him above the knee-roll on the front leg, which was off the ground, so height was an issue as was the angle
Broad to Haddin, 1 run angled in again and it's skewed off a thick inside edge
Broad to Johnson, no run cramps Johnson up, he nudges it down off his hips
Broad to Johnson, FOUR runs that's a solid pull from Johnson to get him off the mark. Shortish on off stump, he gets into position quickly and rolls the wrists, good shot.
Broad to Johnson, no run bouncer now, and Johnson ducks
Anderson to Haddin, no run probing outside off, Haddin defends with a straight bat
Anderson to Haddin, 2 runs pushed through cover and they get a couple of runs
Anderson to Haddin, 2 runs another lovely cover-drive but there's a man out in the deep to keep it to two
Anderson to Haddin, no run left alone outside off
Anderson to Haddin, no run very solid in defence this time
Anderson to Haddin, no run nudged away to cover, no real swing there
Broad to Johnson, no run bangs it in short, Johnson pushes it down defensively
Broad to Johnson, no run bouncer, Johnson thinks about hooking and then changes his mind
Broad to Johnson, no run no shot offered outside off
Broad to Johnson, no run angled across Johnson, who leaves it
Broad to Haddin, 2 runs flicked away off his pads through square leg, it races away quickly but Onions makes good ground to pull off an effective, if not exactly pretty, save
Anderson to Hauritz, no run on off stump, he defends this one safely
Anderson to Hauritz, no run short ball, wide of off and Hauritz leaves it
Anderson to Hauritz, no run no shot offered outside off
Anderson to Hauritz, 1 run punches through cover off the back foot to get off the mark
Anderson to Haddin, no run probing outside off, but Haddin lets it go
Anderson to Haddin, no run Haddin gets in behind it to defend
Broad to Hauritz, no run bouncer, Hauritz ducks underneath it
Broad to Hauritz, 1 run on the hips, Hauritz clips it away in the air over square leg, safely short of the man in the deep
Broad to Haddin, no run angled in and bounces over off stump as Haddin lets it go
Broad to Haddin, no run driven to mid-on this time
Broad to Siddle, no run Siddle could've expected a short one first up, but he gets a fuller ball outside off that he can leave alone
Anderson to Hauritz, no run outside off and left alone
Anderson to Hauritz, 1 run punched through cover off the back foot, Bopara knocks it down and keeps it to a single
Anderson to Siddle, 3 runs guided - though perhaps not deliberately - wide of gully and Siddle is off the mark
Anderson to Hauritz, no run fullish length, punched back down the pitch
Anderson to Hauritz, no run straight ball, defended to the off side by Hauritz
Anderson to Hauritz, no run nudged away to cover again and can't beat the field
Broad to Siddle, no run Broad starts with a Bouncer, to which Siddle ducks and smiles
Broad to Siddle, no run another bouncer, comfortably ducked beneath
Broad to Siddle, no run the third bouncer in a row and again Siddle ducks. 91mph, apparently. That speedgun is about as reliable as a chocolate fire guard
Broad to Siddle, no run a short bumper down the leg side. This is a pointless over so far
Broad to Siddle, no run at last Broad makes Siddle play, and he defends with pleasing solidity
Broad to Siddle, 1 run touch of bounce, Siddle fends it to leg off his glove, steals the strike - and, indeed, retains it. Well done him
Anderson to Siddle, 1 run swings in late on the right-hander who flicks it just past short leg
Anderson to Hauritz, no run beaten! Excellent delivery holding its line outside off. Good length, too short to drive but he drives and misses
Anderson to Hauritz, no run punched out to the off side
Anderson to Hauritz, no run really good line and length just outside off. Haley defends
Anderson to Hauritz, no run down the leg side. Booming swing
Anderson to Hauritz, FOUR runs nicely played, gliding it past gully for four. Played that very late
Broad to Siddle, 1 run drops this out to the off side and immediately calls a single. Well played. Urgent cricket
Broad to Hauritz, FOUR runs on the back foot and four more! Thick outside edge past the slips. Crucial, vital runs for Australia
Broad to Hauritz, no run a bumper. Hauritz ducks
Broad to Hauritz, no run and another short ball, at a highly unlikely 91.6mph. Hauritz plays it well
Broad to Hauritz, no run way, way too wide and short
Broad to Hauritz, 2 runs flicked off his pads and dropped by Cook at short-leg, though that was a seriously tough chance. It was well timed and Cook is standing no more than a metre away
Anderson to Siddle, no run good length, Siddle prods forward and pokes this to point
Anderson to Siddle, FOUR runs shot - shot! Superb on-drive for four. Have some of that
Anderson to Siddle, no run firmly defended out to cover. They think of a single before opting against it
Anderson to Siddle, no run short and wide and left alone
Anderson to Siddle, no run wide of the crease and spearing into his off stump but, again, it's well defended. Firmly defended out to point
Anderson to Siddle, FOUR runs on the drive and it's four more - a flashing edge past a diving point! This is not good for England at all
Broad to Hauritz, 1 run blocked out to cover
Broad to Siddle, no run flashed to gully. Straight to him
Broad to Siddle, 2 runs nudged to leg and they'll get two
Broad to Siddle, no run short and wide outside off and he sways out of the way
Broad to Siddle, 1 run another short one
Broad to Hauritz, no run oh dear. Yet another bouncer
Anderson to Siddle, 1 run drifts this down the leg side and they'll get a single to fine leg
Anderson to Hauritz, no run edged and dropped, is it? Superb attempt by Collingwood at third slip, and in fact that fell short of him so he saved four. Well done
Anderson to Hauritz, no run swings back in, Hauritz flays it out to cover off the back foot
Anderson to Hauritz, 1 run punched out to the off side and they steal a single
Anderson to Siddle, no run edged and again it falls short of Collingwood at third slip, diving to his right
Anderson to Siddle, no run onto the front foot and he defends
Broad to Hauritz, 1 run cuts back into Hauritz who defends out to cover
Broad to Siddle, no run good, straight delivery but Siddle is right behind it, defending it firmly and cautiously
Broad to Siddle, no run onto the front foot, nudging to leg
Broad to Siddle, no run short, wide and flashed to gully
Broad to Siddle, no run shorter delivery which takes Siddle a little by surprise
Broad to Siddle, 2 runs drifts into his pads and Siddle accepts with glee through midwicket
Anderson to Hauritz, no run punched out to the off side
Anderson to Hauritz, no run short of a length, he rocks back and punches it out to mid-off
Anderson to Hauritz, no run ooh, good line but well left by Hauritz
Anderson to Hauritz, no run short of a length, punched again to mid-off
Anderson to Hauritz, no run excellent line, defended out to the off side
Anderson to Hauritz, FOUR runs four more. Sliced past point nicely - Australia are looking disconcertingly comfortable here
Broad to Siddle, no run fuller and straighter and flicked to leg
Broad to Siddle, no run ooh that's a nasty one. A rare brute from Broad who at last bounces him straight, and Siddle ducks into it and receives a blow on his fingers
Broad to Siddle, no run off the back foot, nicely defended out to cover
Broad to Siddle, no run straighter delivery but still short and defended
Broad to Siddle, 2 runs good stuff from Broad! Short, nasty riser that he tries to hook like Greenidge but it comes off a part of his body
Broad to Siddle, no run flashed out to point
Onions to Hauritz, FOUR runs shot! What a beautiful shot, riding the bounce and crisply punching this behind square. Opened the face nicely
Onions to Hauritz, no run very full, very wide, he goes for a drive but misses
Onions to Hauritz, OUT got him! Short of a length outside off, Hauritz goes back and tries to force it off the back foot but can only edge to Collingwood who holds a safe catch at third slip
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run short and wide outside off
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run comfortably left alone outside off
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run again, too wide, and that completes a successful over for Onions
Broad to Siddle, FOUR runs four more! A lucky, flashy edge flies down to third man and Australia reach 200, much to the joy of the yellow-t-shirt brigade in amongst the many England fans
Broad to Siddle, no run reasonable bouncer, sways out of the way

Broad to Siddle, FOUR runs four more - Australia are racing here! Another idiotic short delivery and Siddle hooks it - yes, like a tailender, and not in total control, but he's chancing his arm as well he should
Broad to Siddle, no run glided out to the off side
Broad to Siddle, no run quick bouncer. But yes, another bouncer
Broad to Siddle, no run a bouncer down the leg side
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run left alone outside off
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run wide enough to be left alone, so that's what Hilfenhaus does
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run flashed outside off and he misses
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run wider of the crease, he flashes and misses
Onions to Hilfenhaus, FOUR runs crunched off the back foot - what a shot that is! Sublime from the No. 11
Broad to Siddle, no run yep. Wide of the off stump, though Siddle flashed at it and missed
Broad to Siddle, no run wide, short, left alone
Broad to Siddle, no run another bumper, defended on the back foot
Broad to Siddle, FOUR runs short. Wide. Flashed. Uppercut. Four. Third man. Baffling tactics by Broad and England
Broad to Siddle, 1 run classy pull for a single
Broad to Hilfenhaus, 1 run flicked past leg gully
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run too wide from Onions
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run better line, crunched to point
Onions to Hilfenhaus, no run nice outswinger. He plays and misses. Much better length from Onions, drawing him into the stroke
Onions to Hilfenhaus, 1 run comes forward and angles it past point
Onions to Siddle, no run so close! Siddle is stuck in two minds, tries to duck but can't get out of the way, gloving it high, and it loops short of gully
What's Strauss going to do? I think he said he's having a bat, and he's sprinting off, so it looks like that's the case. We'll let you know as soon as possible.
So, yes, they're going to have another bat. No great surprise really. Here's Brydon until lunch.
Innings Start
Lots of oohs and aahs from the slips
